extendedIngredients.name: fennel bulb
extendedIngredients.original: 1 fennel bulb, stalks trimmed and bulb thinly sliced
extendedIngredients.originalName: fennel bulb, stalks trimmed and bulb thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: parmesan cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese plus 1/4 cup shavings from a block of parmesan (use a vegetable peeler)
extendedIngredients.originalName: grated parmesan cheese plus 1/4 cup shavings from a block of parmesan (use a vegetable peeler)

extendedIngredients.name: pork chops
extendedIngredients.original: 4 boneless center-cut pork chops, each about 3/4 in. thick (1 1/2 lbs. total) and pounded to a thickness of 1/4 in. (see Notes)
extendedIngredients.originalName: boneless center-cut pork chops, each about 3/4 in. thick (1 1/2 lbs. total) and pounded to a thickness of 1/4 in. (see Notes)

title: Pork Milanese with Arugula, Fennel, and Parmesan Salad
summary: Pork Milanese with Arugula, Fennel, and Parmesan Salad might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe makes 4 servings with 440 calories, 37g of protein, and 25g of fat each. For $2.52 per serving, this recipe covers 27% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. A mixture of arugula, olive oil, center-cut pork chops, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. To use up the salt you could follow this main course with the Apple Turnovers Recipe as a dessert. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 66%. This score is good. Try Arugula, Fennel, and Parmesan Salad, Chicken Milanese with Arugula Salad, and Chicken Milanese With Arugula Salad for similar recipes.
instructions: Combine panko, grated parmesan, 1/4 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. pepper on a large plate. In a small bowl, lightly beat eggs. Dip each pork chop in egg, then transfer to panko mixture and coat completely with crumbs. Set aside.                                                                                                 In a large bowl, combine arugula, fennel slices, and parmesan shavings. Drizzle salad with 3 tbsp. olive oil and the lemon juice. Toss, season with remaining salt and pepper, and toss again.                                                                                                 In a 12-in. nonstick frying pan, heat remaining 1/2 cup olive oil over medium-high heat. Add two pork chops and cook, turning once, until crusts are deep golden brown and crisp, 5 to 6 minutes. Transfer chops to a plate and keep warm. Repeat with remaining chops.                                                                                                 Cut each chop in half diagonally and arrange on a serving platter with salad. Serve immediately.                                                                                                Note: Nutritional analysis is per serving.

steps.step: Combine panko, grated parmesan, 1/4 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. pepper on a large plate. In a small bowl, lightly beat eggs. Dip each pork chop in egg, then transfer to panko mixture and coat completely with crumbs. Set aside.
In a large bowl, combine arugula, fennel slices, and parmesan shavings.
Drizzle salad with 3 tbsp. olive oil and the lemon juice. Toss, season with remaining salt and pepper, and toss again.
In a 12-in. nonstick frying pan, heat remaining 1/2 cup olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add two pork chops and cook, turning once, until crusts are deep golden brown and crisp, 5 to 6 minutes.
Transfer chops to a plate and keep warm. Repeat with remaining chops.
Cut each chop in half diagonally and arrange on a serving platter with salad.
